text: [Music]
an interesting statistic with maloi is
that its forests are being stripped of
its soft Pine because of the amount of
coffins that are being made because of
AIDS related deaths so you know you just
expect this place to be sort of gutted
and sort of just an inferno of misery
but it was the a opposite um I one day
the long the the the end of the story is
cuz the beginning of the story is long
but I got lost and I was walking on the
side of a road in maloi my cell phone
didn't work I really had no idea where I
was my my guide or the person who was
driving me didn't know where I was and
I'm sure to some of the the people who
were driving past it must have looked
quite strange to see what they call I
believe I'm I'm deemed a mazunga there
which means white person on the side of
the road um and I kept on walking and I
got to this gas
station and I asked could someone help
me please I I don't know where I am um I
don't even know how to make a phone call
to where I'm supposed to get back to and
this woman who worked there came up to
me and she said I can help you would you
like to use my phone which was probably
expensive for her and she found she
helped me get back to where I needed to
go but as I was waiting for someone to
pick me up uh they uh she said what are
you doing here and I said I'm here doing
stories about HIV AIDS and women in
Malawi and she said I'm one of
them and we formed this this unusual
friendship you know and that was like an
experience that really like kind of is a
those people that you meet that kind of
change your life like here is this woman
who works s days a week is a single
mother um she finds out while I'm there
that her daughter is positive and she's
supporting her family her perspective
husband gave her the illness and is out
and left her and is outs spreading this
illness as well among other women but
yet this woman is the most graceful
woman I've ever met and the most dignifi
woman I've ever met
and was so lonely because she couldn't
talk about her
status but in spite of that just exuded
such warmth and such kindness
and you know it was really meeting her
you really saw the dichotomy of how cold
her reality was but this beautiful heart
that existed in all of this and the
grace that she existed existed in and
and the warmth
